sub_title: Global Grants Controller at the Global Hunger Project
summary:
I live in Utrecht with my wife Hanneke Barth and our two children aged 18 and 15. I have lived and worked in the Netherlands and abroad:

* As UN Volunteer for UNHCR in Tanzania (1998 - 2001)
* As Country Representative for ICCO Nepal in Nepal, India and Pakistan (2009 - 2012)
* As Business Controller Emergency Programs in Syria, Lebanon, Jordan, Haiti, and the Philippines (2012-2014)
* As Business Controller ICCO in the Netherlands (2013 - 2016)

Currently I work for The Global Hunger Project as:

* As Global Grants Controller for the Global Hunger Project in the Netherlands (2016 - 2023). My main tasks and responsibilities are:

- Developing and reviewing large & technically complex budget proposals, contracts and compliance requirements for fundraising for the whole organisation (in USA, Europe, Africa, Asia and Australia).
- Lead in developing Global Financial Management and Grants Tracking systems  
- Conducting and coordinating internal audits in Africa and Asia in the Hunger Project country offices
- Developing Global Policies Development and Training 
- Being a member of the Global Hunger Project Budget team responsible for grant compliance, control, capacity building and due diligence
- Setting up Global coaching program with Regional Finance coaches
- I travel regularly to perform my duties

* As Finance Lead of the Right 2 Grow Consortium (part of the MFA Power of Voices Partnership). This consortium consists of 6 organizations: Save the Children, World Vision, Action for Hunger, Max Foundation, CEEGA and the Hunger Project (2020 - 2023). Currently I am co-leading the consortium to support my colleague Bert van 't Oever. Besides I am the Finance Lead for The Hunger Project Netherlands in the Right 2 Grow Consortium (2020 - 2023). My main tasks and responsibilities are:

- Management of financial planning cycle, allocation of financial and non-financial resources
- Monitoring & control, budgeting, and reporting of financial resources
- Capacity building of the Hunger Project country offices
- I travel regularly to perform my duties
